availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Anderson B. Johnson (Woodford County, Kentucky, farmer)

body.p: Woodford County, Kentucky, farmer. Kentucky native. Married to Judith F. Yancey Johnson in Woodford County, Kentucky, in 1838. Father of Ellen N. Johnson. Resident of Woodford County in 1840. Owned four enslaved persons in Woodford County in 1840. Farmer in Woodford County in 1850. Owned eight enslaved persons in Woodford County in 1850. Farmer in Woodford County in 1860. Owned twenty-nine enslaved persons in Woodford County in 1860.

ab.bibl:

Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Woodford County, District 1, p. 433B.
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Woodford County, District 1.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Woodford County, Versailles, p. 938.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Woodford County, p. 516A.
Kentucky Marriage Records (1783-1965), Madison County Courthouse, Richmond, KY, Woodford County Marriages, Film 000252326.
Barbara A. Vaughn, Descents of Lewis Davis Yancey: with a Brief Genealogy of John Berry (Decorah, IA: The Anundsen Publishing Co., 1986): p. 72.
